intro: Gaultheria poasana, commonly known as the Andean wintergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Gaultheria poasana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows. Its leaves contain aromatic compounds, which contribute to its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
